Sequence Information.Peptide Name: L-amino-acid oxidase (LAAO, LAO, TM-LAO; reptilia, animals)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-negative bacterium:E. coli;S. aureus, B. dysenteriae.
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Function: Catalyzes an oxidative deamination of predominantly hydrophobic and aromatic L-amino acids, thus producing hydrogen peroxide that may contribute to the diverse toxic effects of this enzyme. Exhibits diverse biological activities, such as hemorrhage, hemolysis, edema, apoptosis, and antiparasitic activities By similarity. This protein has antibacterial activity abd cytotoxic activity, as well as an ability to induce platelet aggregation. Effects of snake L-amino oxidases on platelets are controversial, since they either induce aggregation or inhibit agonist-induced aggregation. These different effects are probably due to different experimental conditions.
Sequence Information.Tissue specificity: Expressed by the venom gland. PTM

Literature.Title: Purification, characterization and biological activity of an L-amino acid oxidase from Trimeresurus mucrosquamatus venom.
Literature.Reference: Sheng Wu Hua Xue Yu Sheng Wu Wu Li Xue Bao (Shanghai). 2003 Mar;35(3)219-224.
Literature.Author: Wei JF, Wei Q, Lu QM, Tai H, Jin Y, Wang WY, Xiong YL.
